Hey guess where I'm from !!! 

Yep Portugal, what was once, "one of the biggest colonial empires on earth." (google it), and no its not an South American country. 

Her's a thing or two about Portugal vs USA, let's start with Politics, and finances. 
The last time we had a 2 party system we were in a dictatorship, this says a lot about us and your politics (but this is just my opinion).

U.S.A is the drive-in country, where ppl used to buy stuff without leaving the car, in Portugal we HATE TO WAIT, so for example our ATM system is offers the biggest amount of services in Europe (probably US to), her is a  list of stuff we do in ATM's: 
Buy concert tickets. 
Charge pre payed phones. 
Pay any bill, (electricity, phone, gas, etc.) 
Transfer money, to other accounts.
Create temporary "Credit cards" (to be used online).
Pay tolls. 
And take money duh. 
Other curious tings pay shops in Portugal are almost extinct, they exist mostly so that ppl can go to a place and complain about it ( we are experts at that ).  

Theirs also another things that Portuguese ppl laugh about other countries like U.S.A.
Its how we pay or taxes, because you  guys have to fill out a huge pile of paper, we do it online and for most ppl its already pre field, (HAHA) it takes 10 minute to to your taxes in Portugal and you don't even need to leave your home.
A mother thing,  tolls i talked about you can buy a device to place in your car and you  don't even have to stop.... ( I heard some USA company came here to buy the product don't know if you guys were smart enough to make it work ). 
Last i using an 300MB Internet connection, and we have services that offer 1Gb connections to your home for a reasonable price, with fiber optics to strait in to your home router. 

In short you guys have loads of money, lots of ppl, but are living in the dark ages.
